snippet: Modern power meters are meant to talk directly to power companies, their customers and their customers’ dishwashers, but they have yet to live up to their potential.
abstract: Smart meters that talk directly to electricity providers have potential to usher in so-called dynamic pricing, which is intended to benefit electrical systems by reducing demands during peak hours; dynamic pricing is still many years away despite federal subsidies that have helped finance switch to so-called smart grid because most customers and public service commissions are simply not ready for the change.
lead_paragraph: Modern power meters are meant to talk directly to power companies, their customers and their customers’ dishwashers, but they have yet to live up to their potential.

headline.main: Power Savings of Smart Meters Prove Slow to Materialize
